messages.message:
Hey, I'm using MT to demo deployments and am noticing that the speed to submit and load the next document in review queues is pretty slow.
1. I can imagine ops members getting annoyed at this rate - is it a function of the doc size of the use case we are dealing with or is it the same speed across all use cases?
2. Is the load time included in review metrics? As an ops member I'd be annoyed if this was impacting my metrics
cc @jack.robbins
Is it slow even when youâ€™re just submitting and getting next for 1 file at a time like the subsequent calls essentially? Also cc @Jag
Correct - I feel we should be loading the next one in the queue in the background or something

Thank you for the video. This is important!

Is your deployment or app and input files something you could share with me? This looks good to test with.

I can investigate the /open-files endpoint, but the performance is mainly affected by the file read. I can confirm with a Jaeger trace.

Udit, is pre-loading the next file an option for us?
I think the status endpoint may also be slow.
Ya I'm also taking a look at that rn

I just made a ticket for the BE to speed up the performance of opening up files:
https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/FLOW-10317

I can get to it after the hackathon!
